content.html:
Could you add the prefix g_ to all global variables (only in the new files added in this pull request)? I know this is not consistent all over the code but it will happen in a future pull request.

static bool g_responseExecuted;
static bool g_wrongResponseExecuted;

static std::string g_partition;
static std::string g_topic = "/foo";
static int g_data = 5;
static int g_counter = 0;

pullrequest.title: Issue_45: Service requests without input parameter

content.html:
How about a more "interesting" service?

//////////////////////////////////////////////////
/// \brief Provide a "quote" service.
/// Well OK, it's just single-quote service but do you really need more?
void srvQuote(ignition::msgs::StringMsg &_rep, bool &_result)
{
  std::string awesomeQuote = "This is it! This is the answer. It says here..."
    "that a bolt of lightning is going to strike the clock tower at precisely "
    "10:04pm, next Saturday night! If...If we could somehow...harness this "
    "lightning...channel it...into the flux capacitor...it just might work. "
    "Next Saturday night, we're sending you back to the future!";

  // Set the response's content.
  _rep.set_data(awesomeQuote);

  // The response succeed.
  _result = true;
}

pullrequest.title: Issue_45: Service requests without input parameter

content.raw:
This line generates some warnings on Windows. We have to fix them in Ignition Msgs but in the meantime, could you add this block here to suppress the warnings?


```
#!c++

// ToDo: Remove after fixing the warnings
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(push, 0)
#endif 
#include <ignition/msgs.hh>
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(pop)
#endif
```
content.html:
This line generates some warnings on Windows. We have to fix them in Ignition Msgs but in the meantime, could you add this block here to suppress the warnings?

// ToDo: Remove after fixing the warnings
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(push, 0)
#endif 
#include <ignition/msgs.hh>
#ifdef _MSC_VER
#pragma warning(pop)
#endif

pullrequest.title: Issue_45: Service requests without input parameter

content.html:
Test results:

  • Ubuntu Trusty :large_blue_circle:
  • Windows :large_blue_circle: (except for the unrelated Jenkins warning). Nothing to do here.
  • Homebrew There are three warnings. You can just comment in line _internalReq. E.g.:
std::function<void(const msgs::Empty &, T &, bool &)> f =
  [_cb, _obj](const msgs::Empty &/*_internalReq*/, T &_internalRep,
                    bool &_internalResult)
{
  auto cb = std::bind(_cb, _obj, std::placeholders::_1,
    std::placeholders::_2);
  cb(_internalRep, _internalResult);
};

pullrequest.title: Issue_45: Service requests without input parameter

content.raw:
This test spawns a service that doesn't accept input parameters. The service requester uses a wrong type for the response
argument. The test should verify that the service call does not succeed.
content.html: This test spawns a service that doesn't accept input parameters. The service requester uses a wrong type for the response argument. The test should verify that the service call does not succeed.
